nEmo.Content: 3 hours of samples recorded with the participation of nine actors.
nEmo.Emotions: 6 emotions: anger, fear, happiness, sadness, surprised, and neutral.
nEmo.Paper: nEMO: Dataset of Emotional Speech in Polish

EMOVOME.Content: 999 spontaneous voice messages from 100 Spanish speakers, collected from real conversations on a messaging app.
EMOVOME.Emotions: Valence & arrousal dimensions and 7 emotions: happiness, disgust, anger, surprise, fear, sadness, and neutral.
EMOVOME.Paper: EMOVOME Database: Advancing Emotion Recognition in Speech Beyond Staged Scenarios

EMNS.Content: 1206 high quality labeled utterances by one female speaker (2-3 hours).
EMNS.Emotions: Anger, excitement, disgust, happiness, surprise, sadness, and neutral (plus sarcasm)
EMNS.Paper: EMNS /Imz/ Corpus: An emotive single-speaker dataset for narrative storytelling in games, television and graphic novels

CAVES.Content: Full hd visual recordings of 10 native cantonese speakers uttering 50 sentences.
CAVES.Emotions: Anger, happiness, sadness, surprise, fear, disgust and neutral
CAVES.Paper: A Cantonese Audio-Visual Emotional Speech (CAVES) dataset

BANSpEmo.Content: 792 utterance recordings from 22 unprofessional speakers (11 males and 11 females) of six basic emotional reactions of two sets of sentences.
BANSpEmo.Emotions: angry, disgusted, happy, surprised, sad, fear
BANSpEmo.Paper: BANSpEmo: A Bangla Emotional Speech Recognition Dataset

KBES.Content: 900 audio signals from 35 actors (20 females and 15 males). Each emotion is represented with two intensity levels (low & high)
KBES.Paper: KBES: A dataset for realistic Bangla speech emotion recognition with intensity level

Hi, KIA.Content: A shared short Wakeup Word database focusing on perceived emotion in speech The dataset contains 488 Wakeup Word speech
Hi, KIA.Paper: Hi, KIA: A Speech Emotion Recognition Dataset for Wake-Up Words

Emozionalmente.Content: 6902 labeled samples acted out by 431 amateur actors while verbalizing 18 different sentences
Emozionalmente.Emotions: anger, disgust, fear, joy, sadness, surprise, neutral

BanglaSER.Content: 1467 Bangla speech-audio recordings by 34 non-professional participating actors (17 male and 17 female) from diverse age groups between 19 and 47 years.
BanglaSER.Paper: BanglaSER: A speech emotion recognition dataset for the Bangla language

B-SER.Content: 1224 speech-audio recordings by 34 non-professional participating actors (17 male and 17 female) from diverse age groups between 19 and 47 years.

Kannada.Content: 468 audio samples, six different sentences, pronounced by thirteen people (four male and nine female), in five basic emotions plus one neutral emotion
Kannada.Emotions: Anger, Sadness, Surprise, Happiness, Fear, Neutral

Quechua-SER.Content: 12420 audio recordings (~15 hours) and their transcriptions by 7 native speakers.
Quechua-SER.Emotions: Emotional labels using dimensions: valence, arousal, and dominance.
Quechua-SER.Paper: A speech corpus of Quechua Collao for automatic dimensional emotion recognition

MESD.Content: 864 audio files of single-word emotional utterances with Mexican cultural shaping.
MESD.Emotions: 6 emotions provides single-word utterances for anger, disgust, fear, happiness, neutral, and sadness.
MESD.Paper: The Mexican Emotional Speech Database (MESD): elaboration and assessment based on machine learning

SyntAct.Content: Synthesized database with 997 utterances of three basic emotions and neutral expression based on rule-based manipulation for a diphone synthesizer which we release to the public
SyntAct.Emotions: 6 emotions: angry, bored, happy, neutral, sad and scared
SyntAct.Paper: SyntAct: A Synthesized Database of Basic Emotions

BEAT.Content: 76-Hour and 30-Speaker of 4 different languages: English (60h), Chinese (12h), Spanish (2h) and Japanese (2h).
BEAT.Emotions: 8 emotions: happiness, anger, disgust, sadness, contempt, surprise, fear, and neutral
BEAT.Paper: A Large-Scale Semantic and Emotional Multi-Modal Dataset for Conversational Gestures Synthesis

Dusha.Content: 300 000 audio recordings (~350 hours) of Russian speech, their transcripts and emotiomal labels. The dataset has two subsets: acted and real-life
Dusha.Emotions: 4 emotions: angry, happy, sad and neutral. Arousal and valence metrics are also available.
Dusha.Paper: Large Raw Emotional Dataset with Aggregation Mechanism
Dusha.License: Public license with attribution and conditions reserved

emoUERJ.Content: Ten sentences from eight actors, equally divided between genders, and they were free to choose the phrases for record audios in four emotions (377 audios).

Thorsten-Voice Dataset 2021.06 emotional.Content: 2400 normalized mono recordings by one person (Thorsten Müller) representing 300 sentences.
Thorsten-Voice Dataset 2021.06 emotional.Emotions: Amusement, Disgust Anger, Suprise and Neutral (plus drunk, whispering and sleepy states)

ASED.Content: 2474 recordings by 65 participants (25 females and 40 males)). Recordings were judged and rejected according to the opionion of eight judges.
ASED.Emotions: Five emotions: anger, happiness, fear, sadness and neutral
ASED.Paper: A New Amharic Speech Emotion Dataset and Classification Benchmark

ESCorpus-PE.Content: Spanish peruvian speech gathered from Spanish interviews, TV reports, political debate and testimonials. It contains 3749 utterances, 80 speakers (44 male and 36 female), created from Youtube audios

SUBSECO.Content: 7000 sentence-level utterances of the Bangla language, 20 professional actors (10 males and 10 females), recordings, 10 sentences for 7 target emotions.
SUBSECO.Emotions: Anger, Disgust, Fear, Happiness, Neutral, Sadness and Surprise
SUBSECO.Paper: SUST Bangla Emotional Speech Corpus (SUBESCO): An audio-only emotional speech corpus for Bangla

Audio-Speech-Sentiment.Emotions: 4 emotions provides audio recordings of spoken sentences for anger, happiness, sadness, and neutral emotions.

LSSED.Content: LSSED: A Large-Scale Dataset and Benchmark for Speech Emotion Recognition
LSSED.Emotions: Anger, happiness, sadness, disappointment, boredom, disgust, excitement, fear, surprise, normal, and other.
LSSED.Paper: LSSED: A Large-Scale Spanish Emotional Speech Database for Speech Processing and Machine Learning

MLEnd.Content: ~32700 audio recordings files produced by 154 speakers. Each audio recording corresponds to one English numeral (from "zero" to "billion")
MLEnd.Emotions: Intonations: neutral, bored, excited and question

ASVP-ESD.Content: ~13285 audio files collected from movies, tv shows and youtube containing speech and non-speech.
ASVP-ESD.Emotions: 12 different natural emotions (boredom, neutral, happiness, sadness, anger, fear, surprise, disgust, excitement, pleasure, pain, disappointment) with 2 levels of intensity.
ASVP-ESD.Language: Chinese, English, French, Russian and others

ESD.Content: 29 hours, 3500 sentences, by 10 native English speakers and 10 native Chinese speakers.
ESD.Emotions: 5 emotions: angry, happy, neutral, sad, and surprise.
ESD.Paper: Seen And Unseen Emotional Style Transfer For Voice Conversion With A New Emotional Speech Dataset

MuSe-CAR.Content: 40 hours, 6,000+ recordings of 25,000+ sentences by 70+ English speakers (see db link for details).
MuSe-CAR.Emotions: continuous emotion dimensions characterized using valence, arousal, and trustworthiness.
MuSe-CAR.Paper: The Multimodal Sentiment Analysis in Car Reviews (MuSe-CaR) Dataset: Collection, Insights and Improvements

THAI SER.Content: The recordings are 41 hours, 36 minutes long (27,854 utterances), and were performed by 200 professional actors (112 female, 88 male).
THAI SER.Emotions: 5 main emotions assigned to actors: Neutral, Anger, Happiness, Sadness, and Frustration.

French Emotional Speech Database - Oréau.Content: 79 utterances with 10 to 13 utterances pro emotion by 32 non-professional speakers.
French Emotional Speech Database - Oréau.Emotions: 7 emotions: sadness, anger, disgust, fear, surprise, joy, neutral.

Att-HACK.Content: 25 speakers interpreting 100 utterances in 4 social attitudes, with 3-5 repetitions each per attitude for a total of around 30 hours of speech.
Att-HACK.Emotions: expressive speech in French, 100 phrases with multiple versions (3 to 5) in four social attitudes (friendly, distant, dominant and seductive).
Att-HACK.Paper: Att-HACK: An Expressive Speech Database with Social Attitudes

MSP-Podcast corpus.Content: 100 hours by over 100 speakers (see db link for details).
MSP-Podcast corpus.Emotions: This corpus is annotated with emotional labels using attribute-based descriptors (activation, dominance and valence) and categorical labels (anger, happiness, sadness, disgust, surprised, fear, contempt, neutral and other).

BEASC.Emotions: 6 emotions provides Bangla spoken utterances for anger, happiness, sadness, fear, surprise, and neutral.
BEASC.Paper: BEASC: Bangla Emotional Audio-Speech Corpus - A Speech Emotion Recognition Corpus for the Low-Resource Bangla Language

emotiontts open db.Content: Recordings and their associated transcriptions by a diverse group of speakers.
emotiontts open db.Emotions: 4 emotions: general, joy, anger, and sadness.

URDU-Dataset.Content: 400 utterances by 38 speakers (27 male and 11 female).
URDU-Dataset.Emotions: 4 emotions: angry, happy, neutral, and sad.
URDU-Dataset.Paper: Cross Lingual Speech Emotion Recognition: Urdu vs. Western Languages

BAVED.Content: 1935 recording by 61 speakers (45 male and 16 female).

VIVAE.Emotions: non-speech 6 emotions: achievement, anger, fear, pain, pleasure, and surprise with 3 emotional intensities (low, moderate, strong, peak).
VIVAE.Paper: The Variably Intense Vocalizations of Affect and Emotion (VIVAE) corpus prompts new perspective on nonspeech perception

VESUS.Content: 252 distinct phrases, each read by 10 actors totalling 6 hours of speech.
VESUS.Emotions: 5 emotions: anger, happiness, sadness, fear and neutral.
VESUS.Paper: VESUS: A Crowd-Annotated Database to Study Emotion Production and Perception in Spoken English

Morgan Emotional Speech Set.Content: 999 spontaneous voice messages from 100 Spanish speakers, collected from real conversations on a messaging app.
Morgan Emotional Speech Set.Emotions: Valence & arrousal dimensions and 4 emotions: happiness, anger, sadness, and calmness.
Morgan Emotional Speech Set.Paper: Categorical and Dimensional Ratings of Emotional Speech: Behavioral Findings From the Morgan Emotional Speech Set

PMEmo.Content: Dataset containing emotion annotations of 794 songs as well as the simultaneous electrodermal activity (EDA) signals. A Music Emotion Experiment was well-designed for collecting the affective-annotated music corpus of high quality, which recruited 457 subjects.
PMEmo.Paper: The PMEmo Dataset for Music Emotion Recognition

SEWA.Content: more than 2000 minutes of audio-visual data of 398 people (201 male and 197 female) coming from 6 cultures.
SEWA.Emotions: emotions are characterized using valence and arousal.
SEWA.Language: Chinese, English, German, Greek, Hungarian and Serbian
SEWA.Paper: SEWA DB: A Rich Database for Audio-Visual Emotion and Sentiment Research in the Wild

MELD.Content: 1400 dialogues and 14000 utterances from Friends TV series  by multiple speakers.
MELD.Emotions: 7 emotions: Anger, disgust, sadness, joy, neutral, surprise and fear.  MELD also has sentiment (positive, negative and neutral) annotation  for each utterance.
MELD.Paper: MELD: A Multimodal Multi-Party Dataset for Emotion Recognition in Conversations

ShEMO.Content: 3000 semi-natural utterances, equivalent to 3 hours and 25 minutes of speech data from online radio plays by 87 native-Persian speakers.
ShEMO.Emotions: 6 emotions: anger, fear, happiness, sadness, neutral and surprise.
ShEMO.Paper: ShEMO: a large-scale validated database for Persian speech emotion detection

DEMoS.Content: 9365 emotional and 332 neutral samples produced by 68 native speakers (23 females, 45 males).
DEMoS.Emotions: 7/6 emotions: anger, sadness, happiness, fear, surprise, disgust, and the secondary emotion guilt.
DEMoS.Paper: DEMoS: An Italian emotional speech corpus. Elicitation methods, machine learning, and perception

AESDD.Content: around 500 utterances by a diverse group of actors (over 5 actors) siumlating various emotions.
AESDD.Emotions: 5 emotions: anger, disgust, fear, happiness, and sadness.
AESDD.Paper: Speech Emotion Recognition for Performance Interaction

Emov-DB.Content: Recordings for 4 speakers- 2 males and 2 females.
Emov-DB.Emotions: The emotional styles are neutral, sleepiness, anger, disgust and amused.
Emov-DB.Paper: The emotional voices database: Towards controlling the emotion dimension in voice generation systems

RAVDESS.Emotions: 7 emotions: calm, happy, sad, angry, fearful, surprise, and disgust
RAVDESS.Paper: The Ryerson Audio-Visual Database of Emotional Speech and Song (RAVDESS): A dynamic, multimodal set of facial and vocal expressions in North American English

JL corpus.Content: 2400 recording of 240 sentences by 4 actors (2 males and 2 females).
JL corpus.Emotions: 5 primary emotions: angry, sad, neutral, happy, excited. 5 secondary emotions: anxious, apologetic, pensive, worried, enthusiastic.
JL corpus.Paper: An Open Source Emotional Speech Corpus for Human Robot Interaction Applications

CaFE.Content: 6 different sentences by 12 speakers (6 fmelaes + 6 males).
CaFE.Emotions: 7 emotions: happy, sad, angry, fearful, surprise, disgust and neutral. Each emotion is acted in 2 different intensities.

EmoFilm.Content: 1115 audio instances sentences extracted from various films.
EmoFilm.Emotions: 5 emotions: anger, contempt, happiness, fear, and sadness.
EmoFilm.Paper: Categorical vs Dimensional Perception of Italian Emotional Speech

EmoSynth.Emotions: Emotion (no speech) defined in regard of valence and arousal.
EmoSynth.Paper: The Perceived Emotion of Isolated Synthetic Audio: The EmoSynth Dataset and Results

CMU-MOSEI.Content: 65 hours of annotated video from more than 1000 speakers and 250 topics.
CMU-MOSEI.Emotions: 6 Emotion (happiness, sadness, anger,fear, disgust, surprise) + Likert scale.
CMU-MOSEI.Paper: Multi-attention Recurrent Network for Human Communication Comprehension

VERBO.Content: 14 different phrases by 12 speakers (6 female + 6 male) for a total of 1167 recordings.
VERBO.Emotions: 7 emotions: Happiness, Disgust, Fear, Neutral, Anger, Surprise, Sadness
VERBO.Paper: VERBO: Voice Emotion Recognition dataBase in Portuguese Language

CMU-MOSI.Emotions: Sentiment annotated between very negative to very positive in seven Likert steps.
CMU-MOSI.Paper: Multi-attention Recurrent Network for Human Communication Comprehension

MSP-IMPROV.Emotions: 4 emotions: angry, sad, happy, neutral, other, without agreement
MSP-IMPROV.Paper: MSP-IMPROV: An Acted Corpus of Dyadic Interactions to Study Emotion Perception

CREMA-D.Content: 7442 clip of 12 sentences spoken by 91 actors (48 males and 43 females).
CREMA-D.Emotions: 6 emotions: angry, disgusted, fearful, happy, neutral, and sad
CREMA-D.Paper: CREMA-D: Crowd-sourced Emotional Multimodal Actors Dataset
CREMA-D.License: Open Database License & Database Content License

Example emotion videos used in investiga.Content: 6 videos:Two example videos from each emotion category (angry, happy and neutral) by one female speaker.

EMOVO.Emotions: 6 emotions: disgust, fear, anger, joy, surprise, sadness.
EMOVO.Paper: EMOVO Corpus: an Italian Emotional Speech Database

RECOLA.Emotions: negative and positive sentiment (valence and arousal).
RECOLA.Paper: Introducing the RECOLA Multimodal Corpus of Remote Collaborative and Affective Interactions

GEMEP corpus.Emotions: 12 emotions: amusement, anxiety, cold anger (irritation), despair, hot anger (rage),  fear (panic), interest, joy (elation), pleasure(sensory), pride, relief, and sadness. Plus, 5 additional emotions: admiration, contempt, disgust, surprise, and tenderness.
GEMEP corpus.Paper: Introducing the Geneva Multimodal Expression Corpus for Experimental Research on Emotion Perception

OGVC.Content: 9114 spontaneous utterances and 2656 acted utterances by 4 professional actors (two male and two female).
OGVC.Emotions: 9 emotional states: fear, surprise, sadness, disgust, anger, anticipation, joy, acceptance and the neutral state.
OGVC.Paper: Naturalistic emotional speech collectionparadigm with online game and its psychological and acoustical assessment

LEGO corpus.Emotions: Emotions classified as garbage, non-angry, slightly angry and very angry.
LEGO corpus.Paper: A Parameterized and Annotated Spoken Dialog Corpus of the CMU Let’s Go Bus Information System
LEGO corpus.License: License available with the data. Free of charges for research purposes only.
LEGO corpus.License-link: License available with the data. Free of charges for research purposes only.

SEMAINE.Content: 95 dyadic conversations from 21 subjects. Each subject converses with another playing one of four characters with emotions.
SEMAINE.Emotions: 5 FeelTrace annotations: activation, valence, dominance, power, intensity
SEMAINE.Paper: The SEMAINE Database: Annotated Multimodal Records of Emotionally Colored Conversations between a Person and a Limited Agent

SAVEE.Content: 480 British English utterances by 4 males actors.
SAVEE.Emotions: 7 emotions: anger, disgust, fear, happiness, sadness, surprise and neutral.
SAVEE.License: Free of charges for research purposes only.
SAVEE.License-link: Free of charges for research purposes only.

TESS.Emotions: 7 emotions: anger, disgust, fear, happiness, pleasant surprise, sadness, and neutral.
TESS.Paper: BEHAVIOURAL FINDINGS FROM THE TORONTO EMOTIONAL SPEECH SET

EEKK.Emotions: 4 main emotions: joy, sadness, anger and neutral.

IEMOCAP.Content: 12 hours of audiovisual data by 10 actors in 5 sessions.
IEMOCAP.Emotions: Full: neutral state; happiness; sadness; anger; surprise; fear; disgust; frustration; excited; other. Balance 5 emotions: happiness, anger, sadness, frustration and neutral. Three dimensions: valence, arousal, dominance
IEMOCAP.Paper: IEMOCAP: Interactive emotional dyadic motion capture database

Keio-ESD.Content: A set of human speech with vocal emotion spoken by a Japanese male speaker.
Keio-ESD.Emotions: 47 emotions including angry, joyful, disgusting, downgrading, funny,  worried, gentle, relief, indignation, shameful, etc.
Keio-ESD.Paper: EMOTIONAL SPEECH SYNTHESIS USING SUBSPACE CONSTRAINTS IN PROSODY

EMO-DB.Content: 800 recording spoken by 10 actors (5 males and 5 females).
EMO-DB.Emotions: 7 emotions: anger, neutral, fear, boredom, happiness, sadness, disgust.
EMO-DB.Paper: A Database of German Emotional Speech

eNTERFACE05.Content: Videos by 42 subjects, coming from 14 different nationalities.
eNTERFACE05.Emotions: 6 emotions: anger, fear, surprise, happiness, sadness and disgust.
eNTERFACE05.License: Free of charges for research purposes only.
eNTERFACE05.License-link: Free of charges for research purposes only.

DES.Emotions: 5 emotions: neutral,  surprise,  happiness,  sadness  and  anger
DES.Paper: Documentation of the Danish Emotional Speech Database
